item.title: What do you think about open source .NET?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

And I’m pretty sure they’re making it free to everyone as well

item.source: What do you think about open source .NET?

item.title: What do you think about open source .NET?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:14, topic:547829”]I think it’s great that they’re going down this path. I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again: The Microsoft software development tooling (visual studio, sql server management studio, etc) is second to none. It’s well integrated, easy to use, etc.
The only downside is that visual studio costs a lot. Not that it matters when the company pays for the software licencing.

You can do the same things with other software stacks, like Linux, but the you have to fudge around a whole lot to integrate everything.[/quote]
Visual Studio is free for students ;D

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think about open source .NET?

item.title: What do you think about open source .NET?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I think it’s great that they’re going down this path. I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again: The Microsoft software development tooling (visual studio, sql server management studio, etc) is second to none. It’s well integrated, easy to use, etc.
The only downside is that visual studio costs a lot. Not that it matters when the company pays for the software licencing.

You can do the same things with other software stacks, like Linux, but the you have to fuck around a whole lot to integrate everything.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think about open source .NET?

item.title: What do you think about open source .NET?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:11, topic:547829”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=666735.msg4458897#msg4458897 date=1416444758]

I hope it isn’t too late.

Too late Rust is going to take over
[/quote]
You know Rust in still in beta right?[/quote]

No! But thanks for pointing that out!

Read full topic

item.title: What do you think about open source .NET?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

xdeathstarsx:

fudge off ashi

I hate when people I’ve never see post have a go at me, who are you?

HcoJustin:

Whoever they put in charge of these decisions is doing amazing work

Not quiet, they’ve made some stupid decisions recently. Sometimes I just don’t want to use anything by Microsoft. .NET was a good move and so was what The Enforcer mentioned.

Read full topic
